Building¶

After you’ve chosen a site, and figured out if there is cell coverage, it’s time to build a gage for that site.

Parts to acqure¶

I’ve sorted the parts needed to build the exact same gage out by the same source that I’ve bought them from, but some can be found elsewhere too.

Adafruit¶

Adafruit is a great place for basic geeking supplies, from a soldering iron (which you may also need to acquire, I got the Ladyada’s Electronic Toolkit for my soldering iron, multimeter and other basic tools. )

  • BeagleBone Black Rev C or Adafruit BeagleBone Black Starter Pack which comes with other goodies that are helpful like a baseplate that can be screwed or bolted to something.
  • Maxbotix Weather-Resistant Ultrasonic Rangefinder
  • 6V 5.6W Solar Panel
  • 3.7V 6600mAh Lithium Ion Battery Pack
  • Beaglebone Proto Cape
  • Adafruit Bi-directional Level Shifter
  • NPN Transistor

Amazon¶

  • Orbit 57095 Sprinkler System Box

Maxbotix¶

You could also order the Ultrasonic Rangefinder MB7092 XL direct from Maxbotix. I do believe that they may have some sensors that don’t need to have an inverter that this current model does.

  • MB7950 Mounting Hardware

Andicelabs¶

  • Andicelabs Power Cape
  • Stacking Connectors

Digikey¶

  • 10K Ohm Resistor
  • 1K Ohm Resistor

Inverting¶

http://blog.lemoneerlabs.com/post/Hearing-aids
